text: This list of Maryland state parks includes the state parks and state battlefields listed in the Maryland Department of Natural Resources's current acreage report. Generally, the Maryland Park Service, a unit of and under the authority of the Maryland Department of Natural Resources (DNR), is the governing body for these parks, although some have been turned over to local authorities. ==Maryland state parks== {|class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%" ! style="width:*;" rowspan=2 |Name ! style="width:*;" rowspan=2 |County ! style="width:*;" colspan=2 |Area ! style="width:*;" rowspan=2 |Estab- lished ! style="width:*;" rowspan=2 |River / lake / other ! class="unsortable" rowspan=2 |Image ! style="width:*;" class="unsortable" rowspan=2 |Remarks |- ! acres ! ha |- | Assateague State Park||Worcester|| | style="text- align:center;" | 1956 ||Atlantic Ocean||alt=Horses in marshland||Barrier island with swimming, beachcombing, sunbathing, surfing and fishing |- | Big Run State Park||Garrett|||| ||Savage River Reservoir||alt=River flowing over rocks||Camping, fishing, flat water canoeing, hiking trails, picnicking |- | Bill Burton Fishing Pier State Park||Dorchester, Talbot|| || style="text- align: center;" | 1987 ||Choptank River||alt=Riverscape||Fishing, hiking, cycling |- | Calvert Cliffs State Park|| Calvert|| | style="text-align: center;" | 1960s ||Chesapeake Bay||alt=Cliffs overlooking water||Fossil hunting, hiking trails, fishing, hunting, picnicking, youth group camping, playground, shelters. |- | Casselman River Bridge State Park||Garrett|| | style="text-align: center;" | 1957 ||Casselman River||alt=Single-arch stone bridge over river water||Historic bridge; picnicking |} ==Maryland state battlefields== {|class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%" ! style="width:*;" rowspan=2 |Name ! style="width:*;" rowspan=2 |County ! style="width:*;" colspan=2 |Area ! style="width:*;" rowspan=2 |Estab- lished ! class="unsortable" rowspan=2 |Image ! style="width:*;" class="unsortable" rowspan=2 |Remarks |- ! acres ! ha |- | North Point State Battlefield||Baltimore|| | style="text-align: center;" | 2015 || ||Preserves undeveloped land where War of 1812's Battle of North Point in the larger Battle of Baltimore on September 12, 1814 (Defenders Day) was fought with the invading British Army. |- | South Mountain State Battlefield||Frederick, Washington|| | style="text-align: center;" | 1984 || ||Civil War historic site of Battle of South Mountain in the Maryland Campaign, September 1862 |} ==Former Maryland state parks== *The former Jonas Green State Park was transferred to Anne Arundel County and became Jonas and Anne Catharine Green Park. ==See also== *List of National Park System areas in Maryland ==References== ==External links== *State Park Directory Maryland Department of Natural Resources *Maryland State Parks Maryland Manual On-Line, Maryland State Archives Maryland state parks
title: List of Maryland state parks
